snippet: Villagers near Kunduz say a pro-government militia killed 11 people in the second recent case of reprisal killings of Afghans believed to be Taliban sympathizers.
abstract: Villagers near Kunduz, Afghanistan, say a pro-government militia has killed 11 people in the second recent case of reprisal killings of Afghans believed to be Taliban sympathizers; residents hold that in both cases, the groups received support and protection from American Special Operations forces, a claim that the United States military has denied.

byline.original: By ABDUL MATIN SARFRAZ and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kunduz Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Villagers near Kunduz say a pro-government militia killed 11 people in the second recent case of reprisal killings of Afghans believed to be Taliban sympathizers.
